title: A sum of money at simple interest amounts to Rs. 850 in 3 years and to Rs. 900 in 4 years. What is the sum? - Quora

response.answer_text: Amount (accumulated value) at simple interest is: A = P (1+rn) where A=accumulate value or amount, P = Original Principal or Sum, n = no. of years and r = interest rate per unit sum = R/100 where R = interest rate per cent. So using this formula, 850 =P (1+rx3) = P (1 + 3r) and 900 = P (1+rx4) = P (1 + 4r) ======> by dividing the 1st expression by the 2nd, 90/85 = 18/17 = (1 + 4r)/(1 + 3r) = ======> which gives r = 1/14. With this value of r, we can use either expression and get P like this: 900 = P (1 + 4/14) = P x 1.285714286 =========> P = 900/1.285714286 = 700. So the sum is Rs.700/-.

We know that the formula to find the amount in the case of simple interest is p + ptr/100 = p(1 + tr/100) where p is the principal, t is the time in years and r is the rate of interest. So p(1 +3r/100) = 850 => r = (850/p - 1)×(100/3) ……(1) p(1 + 4r/100)= 900 => r = (900/p - 1)×(100/4) ………(2) Comparing (1) and (2) we get (850/p - 1)×(100/3) = (900/p - 1)100/4 => 4(850/p - 1) = 3(900/p - 1) => 3400/p - 4 = 2700/p - 3 => 700/p = 1 => p = 700 So the sum is 700

If the interest is simple then, We can say that the interest for 1 year from 3rd to 4th is 900–850=50 Interest for previous 3years(as interest remains same in simple interest)=50×3=150 Sum=850–150=700 at interest rate of 7.14% But if it is the case of compound interest the answer will be Sum=713 with interest of 6%(approx)

Simple interest increases every year by same amount According to question a sum became Rs.850 in 3 years and Rs.900 in 4 years Clearly we can see that in one year it is increasing by Rs.50 In 3 years it increased by (50*3)= 150 The sum 3 years ago or initial sum was (850–150)= 700
Difference of 4 year amount & 3 year amount = 1 year interest 900–850=50 One year interest = 50 Sum = amount in 3 year - interest for 3 year Sum = 850- 150 Sum = 700

The interest earned in a year = 900–850= 50. Therefore the interest earned in 3 years would be = 3*50 = 150 The amount after 3 years is given as 850. Amount= Principal+ Interest 850 = P + 150 Hence the Principal is Rs. 700
